## Actuarial Standards of Practice {#sec-ASOPs}

"The Actuarial Standards Board (ASB) sets standards for appropriate actuarial practice in the United States through the development and promulgation of Actuarial Standards of Practice (ASOPs). These ASOPs describe the procedures an actuary should follow when performing actuarial services and identify what the actuary should disclose when communicating the results of those services." ASOPs can be found at https://www.actuarialstandardsboard.org/standards-of-practice/

## Glossary

\footnotesize

+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Term**                            | **Description**                                                                                     | **Reference**                                   |
+:====================================+:====================================================================================================+:================================================+
| **Accounting**                      | module that produces financial statements                                                           | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Allocation**                      | module that distributes portfolio premium to units                                                  | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **BCAR**                            | Best's Capital Adequacy Ratio                                                                       | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Bi-TVaR**                         | convex combination of TVaRs                                                                         | @sec-Selecting-Calibrating                      |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Business Operations**             | module that deals with loss experience                                                              | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Capital**                         | owner-provided funds                                                                                | @sec-What-Into                                  |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Capital Adequacy**                | module dealing with risk and capital sufficiency                                                    | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Capital risk measure**            | rule relating liabilities to required assets                                                        | @sec-Intro-Insco                                |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Capital structure**               | mix of liabilities funding total assets                                                             | @sec-System-Overview, @sec-BO-Capital-Structure |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Charter**                         | formal document setting out the rationale                                                           | @sec-Structure-Monograph                        |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Co-TVaR**                         | conditional TVaR, Natural Allocation of TVaR                                                        | @sec-Risk-Analysis                              |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **co-XTVaR**                        | Conditional XTVaR                                                                                   | @sec-ISA                                        |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Comonotonic**                     | Random variables $X$ and $Y$ are comonotonic if they are nondecreasing functions of a third r.v.    | @sec-Pricing-Allocation                         |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Comonotonic additive**            | Property of a risk measure $\rho$: If $X$ and $Y$ are comonotonic, then $\rho(X+Y)=\rho(X)+\rho(Y)$ | @sec-Pricing-Allocation                         |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Constant cost of capital (CCoC)** | assumption that all layers require the same return                                                  | @sec-Pricing-layers                             |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Distortion function**             | translates attachment probability to rate on line                                                   | @sec-Pricing-layers                             |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Distorted expectation**           | expectation calculated with distorted probabilities $q$                                             | @sec-pricing-units, @sec-pricing-events         |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Distorted expected loss share**   | a unit's share of a layer's distorted expected loss, $\beta_k^i$                                    | @sec-Allocating-Capital                         |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Distorted probability**           | after applying a distortion function, $q$ replaces $p$                                              | @sec-Pricing-layers                             |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Economic Scenario Generator**     | module to generate socioeconomic outcomes                                                           | @sec-System-Overview, @sec-BO-ESG               |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Economic value added (EVA)**      | Profits beyond what is necessary for investors                                                      | @sec-Pricing                                    |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Equal Priority**                  | Rule for distributing funds among claimants                                                         | @sec-Complications                              |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Expected loss share**             | a unit's share of a layer expected loss, $\alpha_k^i$                                               | @sec-Allocating-Capital                         |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Funding equation**                | states that assets are the sum of premiums and investor capital, $a=P+Q$                            | @eq-funding, @sec-Intro-Insco                   |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Gradient**                        | derivative with respect to several variables                                                        | @sec-Risk-Analysis                              |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **InsCo**                           | hypothetical insurer used as a simple example                                                       | @sec-Intro-Insco                                |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Insureds**                        | customers of InsCo, who pay premiums                                                                | @sec-Intro-Insco                                |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Investors**                       | owners of InsCo, who supply capital                                                                 | @sec-Intro-Insco                                |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Law invariance**                  | risk measure depends only on distribution                                                           | @sec-Pricing-layers                             |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Layer**                           | segment of assets between two levels of portfolio loss                                              | @sec-Pricing-layers                             |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Layer funding equation**          | states that layer assets are the sum of premiums and investor capital, $\Delta X_k=P_k+Q_k$         | @eq-layer-funding, @sec-Pricing-layers          |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Likelihood ratio**                | ratio of distorted to original probabilities                                                        | @sec-pricing-events                             |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Margin**                          | difference between premium and expected loss, $M=P-L$                                               | @eq-PLM, @sec-Pricing                           |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Marginal approach**               | examine the effect of a small change; look at first derivative                                      | @sec-Risk-Analysis                              |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Model**                           | simplified representation of reality, usually mathematical                                          | @sec-What-Into, @sec-System-Overview            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Natural Allocation (NA)**         | decomposition of portfolio premium into distorted expectation of unit losses                        | @sec-pricing-units                              |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Natural Allocation of capital**   | allocation of capital consistent with allocation of premium, $Q_k^i$                                | @sec-Allocating-Capital                         |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+

+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Objectivity**                     | synonym for law invariance                                                                          | @sec-Pricing-layers                             |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Parameter uncertainty**           | lack of knowledge about parameters of a process, sometimes modeled as a distribution                | @sec-Uncertainty                                |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Pricing**                         | module assigns technical premium to the portfolio           | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Pricing & Allocation**            | module that assigns technical premiums to units                                                     | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Pricing risk measure**            | rule that relates liabilities to technical premiums                                                 | @sec-Intro-Insco                                |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Pro forma**                       | hypothetical financial statement                                                                    | @sec-System-Overview , @sec-BO-Pro-Forma        |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+

+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Probabilistic database**          | stored sample of random outcomes                                                                    | @sec-BO-Units                                   |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Process risk**                    | randomness in outcomes from a well defined and parameterized stochastic process                     | @sec-Uncertainty                                |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Reinsurance**                     | module that deals with risk transfer                                                                | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Risk appetite**                   | compensation/price limit for taking on risk                                                         | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Risk tolerance**                  | limit of risk the firm is willing to take on                                                        | @sec-System-Overview                            |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **RVaR**                            | Range Value at Risk, window version of VaR                                                          | @sec-Risk-Analysis                              |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Quantity of Interest**            | target metric, statistic, etc., of a simulation exercise                                            | @sec-Uncertainty                                |
+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
| **Spectral risk measure (SRM)**     | risk measure determined by a distortion function                                                    | @sec-Pricing-layers                             |

| **State price**                     | A contract that pays \$1 in a particular state of the world                                         | @sec-pricing-events                             |

| **Tranche**                         | synonym for layer                                                                                   | @sec-Pricing-layers                             |

| **Tail Value at Risk (TVaR)**       | average of losses in a specified tail probability; also CVaR, TCE                                   | @sec-Capital-Adequacy                           |

+-------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+
